metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2961 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: A use-after-free flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s PLP Rosefunctionality in the way a user triggers a race condition by calling bindwhile simultaneously triggering the rose_bind() function. This flaw allowsa local user to crash or potentially escalate their privileges on thesystem.

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty/esm is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2023.01.10').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
